intro: Cryptantha howellii, commonly known as Howell's cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has small, narrow leaves and produces pods that contain several seeds. Cryptantha howellii is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and desert scrub.
